Crit Consensus: Find one of these old serials, friend. They're a tonic for the debilitating malady of Superhero Overload.
Description: Superhero Captain America battles the evil forces of the archvillain called The Scarab, who poisons his enemies and steals a secret device capable of destroying buildings by sound vibrations.
Stars: Elmer Clifton,Dick Purcell,Lorna Gray,Lionel Atwill,Charles Trowbridge
Title: Captain America

Crit Consensus: While it has its moments, Howard the Duck suffers from an uneven tone and mediocre performances
Description: A sarcastic humanoid duck is pulled from his homeworld to Earth where he must stop an alien invasion with the help of a nerdy scientist and a struggling female rock singer.
Stars: Willard Huyck,Lea Thompson,Jeffrey Jones,Tim Robbins,Ed Gale
Title: Howard the Duck

Crit Consensus: Though some may find the plot a bit lacking, Blade's action is fierce, plentiful, and appropriately stylish for a comic book adaptation.
Description: A half-vampire, half-mortal man becomes a protector of the mortal race, while slaying evil vampires.
Stars: Stephen Norrington,Wesley Snipes,Stephen Dorff,Kris Kristofferson,N'Bushe Wright
Title: Blade

Crit Consensus: Faithful to the comics and filled with action, X-Men brings a crowded slate of classic Marvel characters to the screen with a talented ensemble cast and surprisingly sharp narrative focus.
Description: In a world where mutants (evolved super-powered humans) exist and are discriminated against, two groups form for an inevitable clash: the supremacist Brotherhood, and the pacifist X-Men.
Stars: Bryan Singer,Patrick Stewart,Hugh Jackman,Ian McKellen,Famke Janssen
Title: X-Men

Crit Consensus: Though Blade II offers more of what worked in the original, its plot and character development appear to have been left on the cutting room floor.
Description: Blade forms an uneasy alliance with the vampire council in order to combat the Reapers, who are feeding on vampires.
Stars: Guillermo del Toro,Wesley Snipes,Kris Kristofferson,Ron Perlman,Leonor Varela
Title: Blade II

Crit Consensus: Not only does Spider-Man provide a good dose of web-swinging fun, it also has a heart, thanks to the combined charms of director Sam Raimi and star Tobey Maguire.
Description: When bitten by a genetically modified spider, a nerdy, shy, and awkward high school student gains spider-like abilities that he eventually must use to fight evil as a superhero after tragedy befalls his family.
Stars: Sam Raimi,Tobey Maguire,Kirsten Dunst,Willem Dafoe,James Franco
Title: Spider-Man

Crit Consensus: While Ben Affleck fits the role and the story is sporadically interesting, Daredevil is ultimately a dull, brooding origin story that fails to bring anything new to the genre.
Description: A man blinded by toxic waste which also enhanced his remaining senses fights crime as an acrobatic martial arts superhero.
Stars: Mark Steven Johnson,Ben Affleck,Jennifer Garner,Colin Farrell,Michael Clarke Duncan
Title: Daredevil

Crit Consensus: Tightly scripted, solidly acted, and impressively ambitious, X2: X-Men United is bigger and better than its predecessor -- and a benchmark for comic sequels in general.
Description: When anti-mutant Colonel William Stryker kidnaps Professor X and attacks his school, the X-Men must ally with their archenemy Magneto to stop him.
Stars: Bryan Singer,Patrick Stewart,Hugh Jackman,Halle Berry,Ian McKellen
Title: X2: X-Men United

Crit Consensus: While Ang Lee's ambitious film earns marks for style and an attempt at dramatic depth, there's ultimately too much talking and not enough smashing.
Description: Bruce Banner, a genetics researcher with a tragic past, suffers an accident that causes him to transform into a raging green monster when he gets angry.
Stars: Ang Lee,Eric Bana,Jennifer Connelly,Sam Elliott,Josh Lucas
Title: Hulk

Crit Consensus: A good cast fails to elevate this overly violent and by-the-numbers revenge flick.
Description: An undercover FBI agent becomes a vigilante and sets out to unleash his wrath upon the corrupt businessman who slaughtered his entire family at a reunion.
Stars: Jonathan Hensleigh,Thomas Jane,John Travolta,Samantha Mathis,Laura Harring
Title: The Punisher

Crit Consensus: Boasting an entertaining villain and deeper emotional focus, this is a nimble sequel that improves upon the original.
Description: Peter Parker is beset with troubles in his failing personal life as he battles a brilliant scientist named Doctor Otto Octavius.
Stars: Sam Raimi,Tobey Maguire,Kirsten Dunst,Alfred Molina,James Franco
Title: Spider-Man 2

Crit Consensus: Louder, campier, and more incoherent than its predecessors, Blade: Trinity seems content to emphasize style over substance and rehash familiar themes.
Description: Blade, now a wanted man by the FBI, must join forces with the Nightstalkers to face his most challenging enemy yet: Dracula.
Stars: David S. Goyer,Wesley Snipes,Kris Kristofferson,Parker Posey,Ryan Reynolds
Title: Blade: Trinity

Crit Consensus: Jennifer Garner inhabits her role with earnest gusto, but Elektra's tone deaf script is too self-serious and bereft of intelligent dialogue to provide engaging thrills.
Description: Elektra the warrior survives a near-death experience, becomes an assassin-for-hire, and tries to protect her two latest targets, a single father and his young daughter, from a group of supernatural assassins.
Stars: Rob Bowman,Jennifer Garner,Goran Visnjic,Will Yun Lee,Kirsten Zien
Title: Elektra

Crit Consensus: Marred by goofy attempts at wit, subpar acting, and bland storytelling, Fantastic Four is a mediocre attempt to bring Marvel's oldest hero team to the big screen.
Description: A group of astronauts gain superpowers after a cosmic radiation exposure and must use them to oppose the plans of their enemy, Doctor Victor Von Doom.
Stars: Tim Story,Ioan Gruffudd,Michael Chiklis,Chris Evans,Jessica Alba
Title: Fantastic Four (2005)

Crit Consensus: X-Men: The Last Stand provides plenty of mutant action for fans of the franchise, even if it does so at the expense of its predecessors' deeper character moments.
Description: The human government develops a cure for mutations, and Jean Gray becomes a darker uncontrollable persona called the Phoenix who allies with Magneto, causing escalation into an all-out battle for the X-Men.
Stars: Brett Ratner,Patrick Stewart,Hugh Jackman,Halle Berry,Famke Janssen
Title: X-Men: The Last Stand

Crit Consensus: Ghost Rider is a sour mix of morose, glum histrionics amidst jokey puns and hammy dialogue.
Description: When motorcycle rider Johnny Blaze sells his soul to the Devil to save his father's life, he is transformed into the Ghost Rider, the Devil's own bounty hunter, and is sent to hunt down sinners.
Stars: Mark Steven Johnson,Nicolas Cage,Eva Mendes,Sam Elliott,Matt Long
Title: Ghost Rider

Crit Consensus: Though there are more characters and plotlines, and the action sequences still dazzle, Spider-Man 3 nonetheless isn't quite as refined as the first two.
Description: A strange black entity from another world bonds with Peter Parker and causes inner turmoil as he contends with new villains, temptations, and revenge.
Stars: Sam Raimi,Tobey Maguire,Kirsten Dunst,Topher Grace,Thomas Haden Church
Title: Spider-Man 3

Crit Consensus: While an improvement on its predecessor, Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer is nevertheless a juvenile, simplistic picture that has little benefit beyond its special effects.
Description: The Fantastic Four learn that they aren't the only super-powered beings in the universe when they square off against the powerful Silver Surfer and the planet-eating Galactus.
Stars: Tim Story,Ioan Gruffudd,Jessica Alba,Chris Evans,Michael Chiklis
Title: Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer

Crit Consensus: Powered by Robert Downey Jr.'s vibrant charm, Iron Man turbo-charges the superhero genre with a deft intelligence and infectious sense of fun.
Description: After being held captive in an Afghan cave, billionaire engineer Tony Stark creates a unique weaponized suit of armor to fight evil.
Stars: Jon Favreau,Robert Downey Jr.,Gwyneth Paltrow,Terrence Howard,Jeff Bridges
Title: Iron Man

Crit Consensus: The Incredible Hulk may not be quite the smashing success that fans of Marvel's raging behemoth might hope for, but it offers more than enough big green action to make up for its occasionally puny narrative.
Description: Bruce Banner, a scientist on the run from the U.S. Government, must find a cure for the monster he turns into whenever he loses his temper.
Stars: Louis Leterrier,Edward Norton,Liv Tyler,Tim Roth,William Hurt
Title: The Incredible Hulk

Crit Consensus: Punisher: War Zone recalls the excessively violent, dialogue-challenged actioners of the 1980s, and coincidentally feels two decades out of date.
Description: Frank Castle, known as the Punisher, ruthlessly demolishes organized crime, but it starts an even bigger war.
Stars: Lexi Alexander,Ray Stevenson,Dominic West,Julie Benz,Doug Hutchison
Title: Punisher: War Zone

Crit Consensus: Though Hugh Jackman gives his all, he can't help X-Men Origins: Wolverine overcome a cliche-ridden script and familiar narrative.
Description: The early years of James Logan, featuring his rivalry with his brother Victor Creed, his service in the special forces team Weapon X, and his experimentation into the metal-lined mutant Wolverine.
Stars: Gavin Hood,Hugh Jackman,Liev Schreiber,Ryan Reynolds,Danny Huston
Title: X-Men Origins: Wolverine

Crit Consensus: It isn't quite the breath of fresh air that Iron Man was, but this sequel comes close with solid performances and an action-packed plot.
Description: With the world now aware of his identity as Iron Man, Tony Stark must contend with both his declining health and a vengeful mad man with ties to his father's legacy.
Stars: Jon Favreau,Robert Downey Jr.,Mickey Rourke,Gwyneth Paltrow,Don Cheadle
Title: Iron Man 2

Crit Consensus: A dazzling blockbuster that tempers its sweeping scope with wit, humor, and human drama, Thor is mighty Marvel entertainment.
Description: The powerful but arrogant god Thor is cast out of Asgard to live amongst humans in Midgard (Earth), where he soon becomes one of their finest defenders.
Stars: Kenneth Branagh,Chris Hemsworth,Anthony Hopkins,Natalie Portman,Tom Hiddleston
Title: Thor

Crit Consensus: With a strong script, stylish direction, and powerful performances from its well-rounded cast, X-Men: First Class is a welcome return to form for the franchise.
Description: In the 1960s, superpowered humans Charles Xavier and Erik Lensherr work together to find others like them, but Erik's vengeful pursuit of an ambitious mutant who ruined his life causes a schism to divide them.
Stars: Matthew Vaughn,James McAvoy,Michael Fassbender,Jennifer Lawrence,Kevin Bacon
Title: X: First Class

Crit Consensus: With plenty of pulpy action, a pleasantly retro vibe, and a handful of fine performances, Captain America is solidly old-fashioned blockbuster entertainment.
Description: Steve Rogers, a rejected military soldier, transforms into Captain America after taking a dose of a "Super-Soldier serum". But being Captain America comes at a price as he attempts to take down a war monger and a terrorist organization.
Stars: Joe Johnston,Chris Evans,Hugo Weaving,Samuel L. Jackson,Hayley Atwell
Title: Captain America: The First Avenger

Crit Consensus: With a weak script, uneven CG work, and a Nic Cage performance so predictably loony it's no longer amusing, Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance aims to be trashy fun but ends up as plain trash.
Description: Johnny Blaze, tortured by the Ghost Rider's curse, gets a chance of redemption through protecting the Devil's son, whose father is pursuing him.
Stars: Brian Taylor,Nicolas Cage,Ciarán Hinds,Idris Elba,Violante Placido
Title: Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance

Crit Consensus: Thanks to a script that emphasizes its heroes' humanity and a wealth of superpowered set pieces, The Avengers lives up to its hype and raises the bar for Marvel at the movies.
Description: Earth's mightiest heroes must come together and learn to fight as a team if they are going to stop the mischievous Loki and his alien army from enslaving humanity.
Stars: Joss Whedon,Robert Downey Jr.,Chris Evans,Scarlett Johansson,Jeremy Renner
Title: The Avengers

Crit Consensus: A well-chosen cast and sure-handed direction allow The Amazing Spider-Man to thrill, despite revisiting many of the same plot points from 2002's Spider-Man.
Description: After Peter Parker is bitten by a genetically altered spider, he gains newfound, spider-like powers and ventures out to save the city from the machinations of a mysterious reptilian foe.
Stars: Marc Webb,Andrew Garfield,Emma Stone,Rhys Ifans,Irrfan Khan
Title: The Amazing Spider-Man

Crit Consensus: With the help of its charismatic lead, some impressive action sequences, and even a few surprises, Iron Man 3 is a witty, entertaining adventure and a strong addition to the Marvel canon.
Description: When Tony Stark's world is torn apart by a formidable terrorist called the Mandarin, he starts an odyssey of rebuilding and retribution.
Stars: Shane Black,Robert Downey Jr.,Guy Pearce,Gwyneth Paltrow,Don Cheadle
Title: Iron Man Three

Crit Consensus: Although its final act succumbs to the usual cartoonish antics, The Wolverine is one superhero movie that manages to stay true to the comics while keeping casual viewers entertained.
Description: Wolverine comes to Japan to meet an old friend whose life he saved years ago, and gets embroiled in a conspiracy involving yakuza and mutants.
Stars: James Mangold,Hugh Jackman,Will Yun Lee,Tao Okamoto,Rila Fukushima
Title: The Wolverine

Crit Consensus: It may not be the finest film to come from the Marvel Universe, but Thor: The Dark World still offers plenty of the humor and high-stakes action that fans have come to expect.
Description: When the Dark Elves attempt to plunge the universe into darkness, Thor must embark on a perilous and personal journey that will reunite him with doctor Jane Foster.
Stars: Alan Taylor,Chris Hemsworth,Natalie Portman,Tom Hiddleston,Stellan Skarsgård
Title: Thor: The Dark World

Crit Consensus: Suspenseful and politically astute, Captain America: The Winter Soldier is a superior entry in the Avengers canon and is sure to thrill Marvel diehards.
Description: As Steve Rogers struggles to embrace his role in the modern world, he teams up with a fellow Avenger and S.H.I.E.L.D agent, Black Widow, to battle a new threat from history: an assassin known as the Winter Soldier.
Stars: Joe Russo,Chris Evans,Samuel L. Jackson,Scarlett Johansson,Robert Redford
Title: Captain America: The Winter Soldier

Crit Consensus: While the cast is outstanding and the special effects are top-notch, the latest installment of the Spidey saga suffers from an unfocused narrative and an overabundance of characters.
Description: When New York is put under siege by Oscorp, it is up to Spider-Man to save the city he swore to protect as well as his loved ones.
Stars: Marc Webb,Andrew Garfield,Emma Stone,Jamie Foxx,Paul Giamatti
Title: The Amazing Spider-Man 2

Crit Consensus: X-Men: Days of Future Past combines the best elements of the series to produce a satisfyingly fast-paced outing that ranks among the franchise's finest installments.
Description: The X-Men send Wolverine to the past in a desperate effort to change history and prevent an event that results in doom for both humans and mutants.
Stars: Bryan Singer,Patrick Stewart,Ian McKellen,Hugh Jackman,James McAvoy
Title: X-Men: Days of Future Past

Crit Consensus: Guardians of the Galaxy is just as irreverent as fans of the frequently zany Marvel comic would expect -- as well as funny, thrilling, full of heart, and packed with visual splendor.
Description: A group of intergalactic criminals must pull together to stop a fanatical warrior with plans to purge the universe.
Stars: James Gunn,Chris Pratt,Vin Diesel,Bradley Cooper,Zoe Saldana
Title: Guardians of the Galaxy

Crit Consensus: Exuberant and eye-popping, Avengers: Age of Ultron serves as an overstuffed but mostly satisfying sequel, reuniting its predecessor's unwieldy cast with a few new additions and a worthy foe.
Description: When Tony Stark and Bruce Banner try to jump-start a dormant peacekeeping program called Ultron, things go horribly wrong and it's up to Earth's mightiest heroes to stop the villainous Ultron from enacting his terrible plan.
Stars: Joss Whedon,Robert Downey Jr.,Chris Evans,Mark Ruffalo,Chris Hemsworth
Title: Avengers: Age of Ultron

Crit Consensus: Led by a charming performance from Paul Rudd, Ant-Man offers Marvel thrills on an appropriately smaller scale -- albeit not as smoothly as its most successful predecessors.
Description: Armed with a super-suit with the astonishing ability to shrink in scale but increase in strength, cat burglar Scott Lang must embrace his inner hero and help his mentor, Dr. Hank Pym, plan and pull off a heist that will save the world.
Stars: Peyton Reed,Paul Rudd,Michael Douglas,Corey Stoll,Evangeline Lilly
Title: Ant-Man

Crit Consensus: Dull and downbeat, this Fantastic Four proves a woefully misguided attempt to translate a classic comic series without the humor, joy, or colorful thrills that made it great.
Description: Four young outsiders teleport to an alternate and dangerous universe which alters their physical form in shocking ways. The four must learn to harness their new abilities and work together to save Earth from a former friend turned enemy.
Stars: Josh Trank,Miles Teller,Kate Mara,Michael B. Jordan,Jamie Bell
Title: Fantastic Four (2015)

Crit Consensus: Fast, funny, and gleefully profane, the fourth-wall-busting Deadpool subverts superhero film formula with wildly entertaining -- and decidedly non-family-friendly -- results.
Description: A wisecracking mercenary gets experimented on and becomes immortal but ugly, and sets out to track down the man who ruined his looks.
Stars: Tim Miller,Ryan Reynolds,Morena Baccarin,T.J. Miller,Ed Skrein
Title: Deadpool

Crit Consensus: Captain America: Civil War begins the next wave of Marvel movies with an action-packed superhero blockbuster boasting a decidedly non-cartoonish plot and the courage to explore thought-provoking themes.
Description: Political involvement in the Avengers' affairs causes a rift between Captain America and Iron Man.
Stars: Joe Russo,Chris Evans,Robert Downey Jr.,Scarlett Johansson,Sebastian Stan
Title: Captain America: Civil War

Crit Consensus: Overloaded action and a cliched villain take the focus away from otherwise strong performers and resonant themes, making X-Men: Apocalypse a middling chapter of the venerable superhero franchise.
Description: In the 1980s the X-Men must defeat an ancient all-powerful mutant, En Sabah Nur, who intends to thrive through bringing destruction to the world.
Stars: Bryan Singer,James McAvoy,Michael Fassbender,Jennifer Lawrence,Nicholas Hoult
Title: X-Men: Apocalypse

Crit Consensus: Doctor Strange artfully balances its outré source material against the blockbuster constraints of the MCU, delivering a thoroughly entertaining superhero origin story in the bargain.
Description: While on a journey of physical and spiritual healing, a brilliant neurosurgeon is drawn into the world of the mystic arts.
Stars: Scott Derrickson,Benedict Cumberbatch,Chiwetel Ejiofor,Rachel McAdams,Benedict Wong
Title: Doctor Strange

Crit Consensus: Hugh Jackman makes the most of his final outing as Wolverine with a gritty, nuanced performance in a violent but surprisingly thoughtful superhero action film that defies genre conventions.
Description: In a future where mutants are nearly extinct, an elderly and weary Logan leads a quiet life. But when Laura, a mutant child pursued by scientists, comes to him for help, he must get her to safety.
Stars: James Mangold,Hugh Jackman,Patrick Stewart,Dafne Keen,Boyd Holbrook
Title: Logan

Crit Consensus: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2's action-packed plot, dazzling visuals, and irreverent humor add up to a sequel that's almost as fun -- if not quite as thrillingly fresh -- as its predecessor.
Description: The Guardians struggle to keep together as a team while dealing with their personal family issues, notably Star-Lord's encounter with his father the ambitious celestial being Ego.
Stars: James Gunn,Chris Pratt,Zoe Saldana,Dave Bautista,Vin Diesel
Title: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2

Crit Consensus: Spider-Man: Homecoming does whatever a second reboot can, delivering a colorful, fun adventure that fits snugly in the sprawling MCU without getting bogged down in franchise-building.
Description: Peter Parker balances his life as an ordinary high school student in Queens with his superhero alter-ego Spider-Man, and finds himself on the trail of a new menace prowling the skies of New York City.
Stars: Jon Watts,Tom Holland,Michael Keaton,Robert Downey Jr.,Marisa Tomei
Title: Spider-Man: Homecoming

Crit Consensus: Exciting, funny, and above all fun, Thor: Ragnarok is a colorful cosmic adventure that sets a new standard for its franchise -- and the rest of the Marvel Cinematic Universe.
Description: Imprisoned on the planet Sakaar, Thor must race against time to return to Asgard and stop Ragnarök, the destruction of his world, at the hands of the powerful and ruthless villain Hela.
Stars: Taika Waititi,Chris Hemsworth,Tom Hiddleston,Cate Blanchett,Mark Ruffalo
Title: Thor: Ragnarok

Crit Consensus: Black Panther elevates superhero cinema to thrilling new heights while telling one of the MCU's most absorbing stories -- and introducing some of its most fully realized characters.
Description: T'Challa, heir to the hidden but advanced kingdom of Wakanda, must step forward to lead his people into a new future and must confront a challenger from his country's past.
Stars: Ryan Coogler,Chadwick Boseman,Michael B. Jordan,Lupita Nyong'o,Danai Gurira
Title: Black Panther

Crit Consensus: Avengers: Infinity War ably juggles a dizzying array of MCU heroes in the fight against their gravest threat yet, and the result is a thrilling, emotionally resonant blockbuster that (mostly) realizes its gargantuan ambitions.
Description: The Avengers and their allies must be willing to sacrifice all in an attempt to defeat the powerful Thanos before his blitz of devastation and ruin puts an end to the universe.
Stars: Joe Russo,Robert Downey Jr.,Chris Hemsworth,Mark Ruffalo,Chris Evans
Title: Avengers: Infinity War

Crit Consensus: Though it threatens to buckle under the weight of its meta gags, Deadpool 2 is a gory, gleeful lampoon of the superhero genre buoyed by Ryan Reynolds' undeniable charm.
Description: Foul-mouthed mutant mercenary Wade Wilson (a.k.a. Deadpool) assembles a team of fellow mutant rogues to protect a young boy with supernatural abilities from the brutal, time-traveling cyborg Cable.
Stars: David Leitch,Ryan Reynolds,Josh Brolin,Morena Baccarin,Julian Dennison
Title: Deadpool 2

Crit Consensus: A lighter, brighter superhero movie powered by the effortless charisma of Paul Rudd and Evangeline Lilly, Ant-Man and The Wasp offers a much-needed MCU palate cleanser.
Description: As Scott Lang balances being both a superhero and a father, Hope van Dyne and Dr. Hank Pym present an urgent new mission that finds the Ant-Man fighting alongside The Wasp to uncover secrets from their past.
Stars: Peyton Reed,Paul Rudd,Evangeline Lilly,Michael Peña,Walton Goggins
Title: Ant-Man and the Wasp

Crit Consensus: Venom's first standalone movie turns out to be like the comics character in all the wrong ways - chaotic, noisy, and in desperate need of a stronger attachment to Spider-Man.
Description: A failed reporter is bonded to an alien entity, one of many symbiotes who have invaded Earth. But the being takes a liking to Earth and decides to protect it.
Stars: Ruben Fleischer,Tom Hardy,Michelle Williams,Riz Ahmed,Scott Haze
Title: Venom

Crit Consensus: Packed with action, humor, and visual thrills, Captain Marvel introduces the MCU's latest hero with an origin story that makes effective use of the franchise's signature formula.
Description: Carol Danvers becomes one of the universe's most powerful heroes when Earth is caught in the middle of a galactic war between two alien races.
Stars: Anna Boden,Brie Larson,Samuel L. Jackson,Ben Mendelsohn,Jude Law
Title: Captain Marvel

Crit Consensus: Exciting, entertaining, and emotionally impactful, Avengers: Endgame does whatever it takes to deliver a satisfying finale to Marvel's epic Infinity Saga.
Description: After the devastating events of Avengers: Infinity War (2018), the universe is in ruins. With the help of remaining allies, the Avengers assemble once more in order to reverse Thanos' actions and restore balance to the universe.
Stars: Joe Russo,Robert Downey Jr.,Chris Evans,Mark Ruffalo,Chris Hemsworth
Title: Avengers: Endgame

Crit Consensus: Dark Phoenix ends an era of the X-Men franchise by taking a second stab at adapting a classic comics arc -- with deeply disappointing results.
Description: Jean Grey begins to develop incredible powers that corrupt and turn her into a Dark Phoenix, causing the X-Men to decide if her life is worth more than all of humanity.
Stars: Simon Kinberg,James McAvoy,Michael Fassbender,Jennifer Lawrence,Nicholas Hoult
Title: X-Men: Dark Phoenix

Crit Consensus: A breezily unpredictable blend of teen romance and superhero action, Spider-Man: Far from Home stylishly sets the stage for the next era of the MCU.
Description: Following the events of Avengers: Endgame (2019), Spider-Man must step up to take on new threats in a world that has changed forever.
Stars: Jon Watts,Tom Holland,Samuel L. Jackson,Jake Gyllenhaal,Marisa Tomei
Title: Spider-Man: Far from Home

Crit Consensus: Rendering a list of potentially explosive ingredients mostly inert, The New Mutants is a franchise spinoff that's less than the sum of its super-powered parts.
Description: Five young mutants, just discovering their abilities while held in a secret facility against their will, fight to escape their past sins and save themselves.
Stars: Josh Boone,Maisie Williams,Anya Taylor-Joy,Charlie Heaton,Alice Braga
Title: The New Mutants

Crit Consensus: Even at under an hour, this children's fantasy is sluggishly paced by today's standards...but it does have its charms and a relevant social message at its core.
Description: When underground beings explore the surface world from a deep oil well and inadvertantly cause a panic, only Superman can prevent a tragedy.
Stars: George Reeves,Phyllis Coates,Jeff Corey,Walter Reed
Title: Superman and the Mole-Men

Crit Consensus: Batman: The Movie elevates camp to an art form -- and has a blast doing it, every gloriously tongue-in-cheek inch of the way.
Description: The Dynamic Duo faces four supervillains who plan to hold the world for ransom with the help of a secret invention that instantly dehydrates people.
Stars: Adam West,Burt Ward,Lee Meriwether,Cesar Romero
Title: Batman: The Movie

Crit Consensus: Superman deftly blends humor and gravitas, taking advantage of the perfectly cast Christopher Reeve to craft a loving, nostalgic tribute to an American pop culture icon.
Description: An alien orphan is sent from his dying planet to Earth, where he grows up to become his adoptive home's first and greatest superhero.
Stars: Christopher Reeve,Margot Kidder,Gene Hackman,Marlon Brando
Title: Superman

Crit Consensus: The humor occasionally stumbles into slapstick territory, and the special effects are dated, but Superman II meets, if not exceeds, the standard set by its predecessor.
Description: Superman agrees to sacrifice his powers to start a relationship with Lois Lane, unaware that three Kryptonian criminals he inadvertently released are conquering Earth.
Stars: Gene Hackman,Christopher Reeve,Margot Kidder,Ned Beatty
Title: Superman II

Crit Consensus: Unabashedly campy -- often to its detriment -- Swamp Thing is not without its charms, among them Adrienne Barbeau as the damsel in distress.
Description: After a violent incident with a special chemical, a research scientist is turned into a swamp plant monster.
Stars: Louis Jourdan,Adrienne Barbeau,Ray Wise,David Hess
Title: Swamp Thing

Crit Consensus: When not overusing sight gags, slapstick, and Richard Pryor, Superman III resorts to plot points rehashed from the previous Superman flicks.
Description: Synthetic kryptonite laced with tar splits Superman in two: good Clark Kent and bad Man of Steel.
Stars: Christopher Reeve,Richard Pryor,Margot Kidder,Jackie Cooper
Title: Superman III

Crit Consensus: The effects are cheesy and Supergirl's wide-eyed, cheery heroine simply isn't interesting to watch for an hour and a half.
Description: After losing a powerful orb, Kara Zor-El, Superman's cousin, comes to Earth to retrieve it and instead finds herself up against a wicked witch.
Stars: Helen Slater,Faye Dunaway,Peter O'Toole,Mia Farrow
Title: Supergirl

Crit Consensus: The Superman series bottoms out here: the action is boring, the special effects look cheaper, and none of the actors appear interested in where the plot's going.
Description: The Man of Steel crusades for nuclear disarmament and meets Lex Luthor's latest creation, Nuclear Man.
Stars: Christopher Reeve,Gene Hackman,Margot Kidder,Jackie Cooper
Title: Superman IV: The Quest for Peace

Crit Consensus: A mad scientist's (Louis Jourdan) vegetarian stepdaughter (Heather Locklear) falls in love with one of his leafy failures.
Description: In this tongue-in-cheek sequel, the benevolent bog creature falls for the vegetarian, plant-loving daughter of the evil scientist who created him.
Stars: Dick Durock,Heather Locklear,Louis Jourdan,Sarah Douglas
Title: The Return of Swamp Thing

Crit Consensus: An eerie, haunting spectacle, Batman succeeds as dark entertainment, even if Jack Nicholson's Joker too often overshadows the title character.
Description: The Dark Knight of Gotham City begins his war on crime with his first major enemy being Jack Napier, a criminal who becomes the clownishly homicidal Joker.
Stars: Michael Keaton,Jack Nicholson,Kim Basinger,Robert Wuhl
Title: Batman

Crit Consensus: Director Tim Burton's dark, brooding atmosphere, Michael Keaton's work as the tormented hero, and the flawless casting of Danny DeVito as The Penguin and Christopher Walken as, well, Christopher Walken make the sequel better than the first.
Description: While Batman deals with a deformed man calling himself the Penguin wreaking havoc across Gotham with the help of a cruel businessman, a female employee of the latter becomes the Catwoman with her own vendetta.
Stars: Michael Keaton,Danny DeVito,Michelle Pfeiffer,Christopher Walken
Title: Batman Returns

Crit Consensus: Loud, excessively busy, and often boring, Batman Forever nonetheless has the charisma of Jim Carrey and Tommy Lee Jones to offer mild relief.
Description: Batman must battle former district attorney Harvey Dent, who is now Two-Face and Edward Nygma, The Riddler with help from an amorous psychologist and a young circus acrobat who becomes his sidekick, Robin.
Stars: Val Kilmer,Tommy Lee Jones,Jim Carrey,Nicole Kidman
Title: Batman Forever

Crit Consensus: Joel Schumacher's tongue-in-cheek attitude hits an unbearable limit in Batman & Robin resulting in a frantic and mindless movie that's too jokey to care much for.
Description: Batman and Robin try to keep their relationship together even as they must stop Mr. Freeze and Poison Ivy from freezing Gotham City.
Stars: Arnold Schwarzenegger,George Clooney,Chris O'Donnell,Uma Thurman
Title: Batman & Robin

Crit Consensus: Steel is a badly-acted movie that indulges not only in superhero cliches, but also the sappy TV-movie-of-the-week ones.
Description: A scientist for the military turns himself into a cartoon-like superhero when a version of one of his own weapons is being used against enemies.
Stars: Shaquille O'Neal,Annabeth Gish,Judd Nelson,Richard Roundtree
Title: Steel

Crit Consensus: Halle Berry is the lone bright spot, but even she can't save this laughable action thriller.
Description: A shy woman, endowed with the speed, reflexes, and senses of a cat, walks a thin line between criminal and hero, even as a detective doggedly pursues her, fascinated by both of her personas.
Stars: Halle Berry,Sharon Stone,Benjamin Bratt,Lambert Wilson
Title: Catwoman

Crit Consensus: Despite solid production values and an intriguing premise, Constantine lacks the focus of another spiritual shoot-em-up: The Matrix.
Description: Supernatural exorcist and demonologist John Constantine helps a policewoman prove her sister's death was not a suicide, but something more.
Stars: Keanu Reeves,Rachel Weisz,Djimon Hounsou,Shia LaBeouf
Title: Constantine

Crit Consensus: Brooding and dark, but also exciting and smart, Batman Begins is a film that understands the essence of one of the definitive superheroes.
Description: After training with his mentor, Batman begins his fight to free crime-ridden Gotham City from corruption.
Stars: Christian Bale,Michael Caine,Ken Watanabe,Liam Neeson
Title: Batman Begins

Crit Consensus: Bryan Singer's reverent and visually decadent adaptation gives the Man of Steel welcome emotional complexity. The result: a satisfying stick-to-your-ribs adaptation.
Description: Superman returns to Earth after spending five years in space examining his homeworld Krypton. But he finds things have changed while he was gone, and he must once again prove himself important to the world.
Stars: Brandon Routh,Kevin Spacey,Kate Bosworth,James Marsden
Title: Superman Returns

Crit Consensus: Dark, complex, and unforgettable, The Dark Knight succeeds not just as an entertaining comic book film, but as a richly thrilling crime saga.
Description: When the menace known as the Joker wreaks havoc and chaos on the people of Gotham, Batman must accept one of the greatest psychological and physical tests of his ability to fight injustice.
Stars: Christian Bale,Heath Ledger,Aaron Eckhart,Michael Caine
Title: The Dark Knight

Crit Consensus: Gritty and visually striking, Watchmen is a faithful adaptation of Alan Moore's graphic novel, but its complex narrative structure may make it difficult for it to appeal to viewers not already familiar with the source material.
Description: In 1985 where former superheroes exist, the murder of a colleague sends active vigilante Rorschach into his own sprawling investigation, uncovering something that could completely change the course of history as we know it.
Stars: Jackie Earle Haley,Patrick Wilson,Carla Gugino,Malin Akerman
Title: Watchmen

Crit Consensus: Josh Brolin gives it his best shot, but he can't keep the short, unfocused Jonah Hex from collapsing on the screen.
Description: The U.S. military makes a scarred bounty hunter with warrants on his own head an offer he cannot refuse: in exchange for his freedom, he must stop a terrorist who is ready to unleash Hell on Earth.
Stars: Josh Brolin,Megan Fox,John Malkovich,Michael Fassbender
Title: Jonah Hex

Crit Consensus: Noisy, overproduced, and thinly written, Green Lantern squanders an impressive budget and decades of comics mythology.
Description: Reckless test pilot Hal Jordan is granted an alien ring that bestows him with otherworldly powers that inducts him into an intergalactic police force, the Green Lantern Corps.
Stars: Ryan Reynolds,Blake Lively,Peter Sarsgaard,Mark Strong
Title: Green Lantern

Crit Consensus: The Dark Knight Rises is an ambitious, thoughtful, and potent action film that concludes Christopher Nolan's franchise in spectacular fashion.
Description: Eight years after the Joker's reign of anarchy, Batman, with the help of the enigmatic Catwoman, is forced from his exile to save Gotham City from the brutal guerrilla terrorist Bane.
Stars: Christian Bale,Tom Hardy,Anne Hathaway,Gary Oldman
Title: The Dark Knight Rises

Crit Consensus: Man of Steel's exhilarating action and spectacle can't fully overcome its detours into generic blockbuster territory.
Description: An alien child is evacuated from his dying world and sent to Earth to live among humans. His peace is threatened, when other survivors of his home planet invade Earth.
Stars: Henry Cavill,Amy Adams,Michael Shannon,Diane Lane
Title: Man of Steel

Crit Consensus: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice smothers a potentially powerful story -- and some of America's most iconic superheroes -- in a grim whirlwind of effects-driven action.
Description: Fearing that the actions of Superman are left unchecked, Batman takes on the Man of Steel, while the world wrestles with what kind of a hero it really needs.
Stars: Ben Affleck,Henry Cavill,Amy Adams,Jesse Eisenberg
Title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice

Crit Consensus: Suicide Squad boasts a talented cast and a little more humor than previous DCEU efforts, but they aren't enough to save the disappointing end result from a muddled plot, thinly written characters, and choppy directing.
Description: A secret government agency recruits some of the most dangerous incarcerated super-villains to form a defensive task force. Their first mission: save the world from the apocalypse.
Stars: Will Smith,Jared Leto,Margot Robbie,Viola Davis
Title: Suicide Squad

Crit Consensus: Thrilling, earnest, and buoyed by Gal Gadot's charismatic performance, Wonder Woman succeeds in spectacular fashion.
Description: When a pilot crashes and tells of conflict in the outside world, Diana, an Amazonian warrior in training, leaves home to fight a war, discovering her full powers and true destiny.
Stars: Gal Gadot,Chris Pine,Robin Wright,Lucy Davis
Title: Wonder Woman

Crit Consensus: Justice League leaps over a number of DC movies, but its single bound isn't enough to shed the murky aesthetic, thin characters, and chaotic action that continue to dog the franchise.
Description: Fueled by his restored faith in humanity and inspired by Superman's selfless act, Bruce Wayne enlists the help of his new-found ally, Diana Prince, to face an even greater enemy.
Stars: Ben Affleck,Gal Gadot,Jason Momoa,Ezra Miller
Title: Justice League

Crit Consensus: Aquaman swims with its entertainingly ludicrous tide, offering up CGI superhero spectacle that delivers energetic action with an emphasis on good old-fashioned fun.
Description: Arthur Curry, the human-born heir to the underwater kingdom of Atlantis, goes on a quest to prevent a war between the worlds of ocean and land.
Stars: Jason Momoa,Amber Heard,Willem Dafoe,Patrick Wilson
Title: Aquaman

Crit Consensus: An effortlessly entertaining blend of humor and heart, Shazam! is a superhero movie that never forgets the genre's real power: joyous wish fulfillment.
Description: A newly fostered young boy in search of his mother instead finds unexpected super powers and soon gains a powerful enemy.
Stars: Zachary Levi,Mark Strong,Asher Angel,Jack Dylan Grazer
Title: Shazam!

Crit Consensus: Joker gives its infamous central character a chillingly plausible origin story that serves as a brilliant showcase for its star -- and a dark evolution for comics-inspired cinema.
Description: In Gotham City, mentally troubled comedian Arthur Fleck is disregarded and mistreated by society. He then embarks on a downward spiral of revolution and bloody crime. This path brings him face-to-face with his alter-ego: the Joker.
Stars: Joaquin Phoenix,Robert De Niro,Zazie Beetz,Frances Conroy
Title: Joker

Crit Consensus: With a fresh perspective, some new friends, and loads of fast-paced action, Birds of Prey captures the colorfully anarchic spirit of Margot Robbie's Harley Quinn.
Description: After splitting with the Joker, Harley Quinn joins superheroes Black Canary, Huntress and Renee Montoya to save a young girl from an evil crime lord.
Stars: Margot Robbie,Rosie Perez,Mary Elizabeth Winstead,Jurnee Smollett
Title: Birds of Prey

Crit Consensus: Wonder Woman 1984 struggles with sequel overload, but still offers enough vibrant escapism to satisfy fans of the franchise and its classic central character.
Description: Diana must contend with a work colleague and businessman, whose desire for extreme wealth sends the world down a path of destruction, after an ancient artifact that grants wishes goes missing.
Stars: Gal Gadot,Chris Pine,Kristen Wiig,Pedro Pascal
Title: Wonder Woman 1984
